description:
XML returned from nova ec2 api for Action=DescribeInstances is invalid when filtered by an instance with an attached volume.  The closing tag of rootDeviceName xml is truncated.  No filter returns valid xml (describe all instances) and filtering on specific instance without an attached volume returns valid xml.

          <rootDeviceName>/dev/vda</roo       <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>

Complete request/response from packet capture:  http://paste.openstack.org/show/56741/

python-2.7.3-0ubuntu3.4
nova --version
2.15.0.39
title: nova-api ec2 DescribeInstaces returns invalid xml under certain conditions

comments.content:
I have checked this bug on Juno.The xml returned by euca-describe-instances filtered by instance id was proper when volume is attached.

Following are the tags returnd for the attached volume and root device.

 <blockDeviceMapping>
            <item>
              <deviceName>/dev/vdb</deviceName>
              <ebs>
                <status>attached</status>
                <deleteOnTermination>false</deleteOnTermination>
                <volumeId>vol-00000001</volumeId>
                <attachTime/>
              </ebs>
            </item>
 </blockDeviceMapping>
......
  <rootDeviceName>/dev/vda</rootDeviceName>
   <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
